MAINTAIN FUEL FLOW IN GREEN ARC

steps.action: LEAN TO OBTAIN MAXIMUM IDLE RPM

title: Shutdown
subsection: Icing Conditions: In Flight (Serials w/ FIKI)

steps.instruction: Exit icing conditions. Turn back or change altitude.

steps.action: ENGAGE TO HOLD HEADING AND ALTITUDE

title: Landing With Failed Brakes One brake inoperative

steps.instruction: Land on the side of runway corresponding to the inoperative brake.
Maintain directional control using rudder and working brake.

title: Landing With Failed Brakes Both brakes inoperative

steps.instruction: Divert to the longest, widest runway with the most direct headwind.
Land on downwind side of the runway.
Use the rudder for obstacle avoidance.
Perform Emergency Engine Shutdown on Ground Checklist.

title: Landing With Flat Tire Main Gear

steps.instruction: Land on the side of the runway corresponding to the good tire.
Maintain directional control with the brakes and rudder.
Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal engine shutdown.

title: Landing With Flat Tire Nose Gear

steps.instruction: Land in the center of the runway.
Hold the nosewheel off the ground as long as possible.
Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal engine shutdown.

steps.action: ADJUST FUEL FLOW TO TOP OF GREEN ARC

steps.instruction: Perform Overboost / Pressure Relief Valve Emergency Checklist.
Wait 20 seconds before next start attempt.
Perform Alt 1 Caution (Failure) and Alt 2 Caution (Failure) Checklists.
Main Bus 1, 2 and Non-Essential Bus Loads
Main Bus 1, 2 and Essential Bus Voltages

sub_steps.instruction: If flight conditions permit, consider shedding the following to preserve Battery 1:
Convenience Power (aux items plugged into armrest jack)

steps.instruction: Continue Flight, avoiding IMC or night flight as able (reduced power redundancy).
Continue Flight, avoiding IMC or night flight as able (reduced power redundancy).

sub_steps.instruction: Exit icing conditions using attitude, altitude, and power instruments.

steps.instruction: Stop aircraft and allow the brakes to cool.

sub_steps.instruction: See Performance Tab - Oxygen Duration: calculate duration based on remaining pressure, number of occupants and type of device (mask or cannula).

steps.instruction: Perform Normal Descent as necessary, dependent on duration calculation.
Annunciation indicated tank pressure is between 800 and 400 PSI. See Performance Tab - Oxygen Duration.

steps.action: REPLENISH IF USE OF OXYGEN IS ANTICIPATED

steps.instruction: If use of oxygen is anticipated, verify adequate oxygen supply for flight duration. See Performance Tab - Oxygen Duration.

sub_steps.instruction: Execute a forward slip as required for visibility.
Avoid taxiing without adequate forward visibility.

steps.instruction: Revert to AUTO control of the fluid source to control the fluid quantity.

sub_steps.instruction: Revert to manual control of the fluid source to control the fluid level quantity.
Repeat operation of windshield pump to verify metering pumps are primed properly as evidenced by deicing fluid exiting windshield nozzles.
Repeat operation of windshield pump to verify metering pumps are primed properly as evidenced by deicing fluid exiting windshield nozzles.
Repeat operation of windshield pump to verify metering pumps are primed properly as evidenced by deicing fluid exiting windshield nozzles.

steps.action: MAINTAIN 95-177 KIAS AND LESS THAN 204 KTAS

steps.instruction: Fly aircraft normally using airframe buffet as the stall warning. Ice accumulations on the stall warning vane may result in unreliable stall warning system operation.

title: Left/Right Anti-Ice Fluid Level - Serials 22T-1460, 22T1471, 22T-1473 thru 22T-1709, 22T-1732

steps.instruction: Revert to manual control of the fluid source to control the fluid level quantity.

sub_steps.instruction: Repeat operation of windshield pump to verify metering pumps are primed properly as evidenced by deicing fluid exiting windshield nozzles.

steps.instruction: Monitor CAS for BRAKE TEMP Caution. Stop aircraft and allow the brakes to cool if necessary.

steps.action: IDLE CUTOFF THEN SLOWLY ADVANCE UNTIL ENGINE STARTS

steps.instruction: Perform Engine Airstart, CAPS Deployment or Emergency Landing w/o Engine Power Checklist, as required.

steps.action: WARM ENGINE AT PARTIAL POWER IF REQUIRED
WARM ENGINE AT PARTIAL POWER IF REQUIRED FOR SMOOTH OPERATION

steps.instruction: If engine will not start, perform Emergency Landing w/o Power Checklist.
BAT 1, BAT 2, ALT 1, and ALT 2 Switches
If possible, side slip to keep flames away from fuel tank and cabin.
If flames persist, perform Emergency Engine Shutdown on

ADJUST FOR EGTS BETWEEN 1300 TO 1400 ºF

steps.instruction: Descend to MINIMUM SAFE ALTITUDE from which a landing may be safely accomplished.

steps.action: CONTINUE USING REMAINING GAUGES AS REPRESENTATIVE

REDUCE TO MINIMUM NECESSARY FOR SUSTAINED FLIGHT

title: Low Fuel Quantity in Left Tank
Low Fuel Quantity in Right Tank

steps.instruction: Mixture Lever .. ADJUST FUEL FLOW TO TOP OF GREEEN ARC
Perform Alt 1 Caution (Failure) Checklist (do not reset alternator).
Perform Alt 2 Caution (Failure) Checklist (do not reset alternator).

title: High or Low Voltage on Essential Bus

steps.instruction: Main Bus 1 and Main Bus 2 Voltages (M1 and M2)
Perform appropriate M Bus 1 Warning or M Bus 2 Warning Checklist.
Perform Alt 1 Caution (Failure) and Alt 2 Caution (Failure) Checklists.

sub_steps.instruction: If flight conditions permit, consider shedding: Air Conditioning, Landing Light, Pitot Heat, Cabin Fan, Nav Lights, Strobe Lights, Audio Panel, COM 2, Yaw Damper

steps.instruction: Land as soon as practicable (Battery reserve only).
Initiate Emergency Descent to below 12,500 ft:
Initiate Normal Descent as soon as practical.

title: Anti-Ice System Failure / Excessive Ice Accumulation

sub_steps.instruction: Repeat operation of windshield pump to verify metering pumps are primed properly as evidenced by deicing fluid exiting windshield nozzles.

steps.instruction: Minimum Approach Speed w/ Residual Ice (Flaps 50%)

title: Unreliable Left and Right Fluid Quantity

steps.instruction: Verify Avionics System has switched to functioning AHRS.
Be prepared to revert to Standby Instruments (Attitude, Heading).

title: Inadvertent Spiral Dive During IMC Flight

steps.instruction: Stop the spiral dive by using coordinated aileron and rudder control while referring to the attitude indicator and turn coordinator to level the wings.
Cautiously apply elevator back pressure to bring airplane to level flight attitude.
Use autopilot if functional otherwise maintain a constant heading through the coordinated aileron and rudder inputs.
Exit IMC conditions as soon as possible.
BAT 1, BAT 2, ALT 1, and ALT 2 Switches
Stop aircraft and allow the brakes to cool.
Wait 1 minute before next start attempt.
BAT 1, BAT 2, ALT 1, and ALT 2 Switches
After the airplane comes to a complete stop, evacuate quickly and move upwind.
